item.title: The PBX Disappears With Hosted Voice
item.description:
Mid-size and large businesses are accustomed to managing their in-house phone systems, believing that a PBX or Key telephone system is necessary for internal calls. Hosted voice service challenges this notion, requiring only the phones themselves and sometimes providing even those. Hosted Voice, also called Hosted VoIP or Hosted PBX, is a cloud-based service. The PBX system still exists but resides at the service provider’s location, not yours. item.title: Can Hosted Voice Cut Your Phone Costs In Half?
item.description:
In the past, businesses and individuals could save significantly by choosing alternative long-distance phone providers. This became possible with deregulation, breaking the monopoly of local phone companies. This shift was made simple for customers, requiring minimal effort on their part to experience reduced long-distance bills. A similar shift is happening now with businesses transitioning from traditional, in-house phone systems to cloud-based phone services.
